bibl.note: This document is a letter written by Susan Burger to her cousin, Martha Burger, on February 9, 1844. In the letter, Susan tells Martha what subjects she is studying in school and recommends that she attend school also.

div1.p: I take the opportunity of writing to you a few lines that we are all well at this time hoping that thes few lines will find you in the same state of health. I am going to school at this to Mr Ress I am studying Grammar Philosophy Astronomy & Arrithmatick I want to you to come and go to school if you cannot come to school I wat you to come and see me very soon Elizabeth Sullivan sends ther best love and respects to you
I want you to write to me as soon as you can
I want you to tell doct Doct Raggling that I send my best love and respects to him.
